result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Henke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First 90 must be in jail, balance may be on electronic monitoring if approved by jail and risk assessment.
Huber granted for employment and counseling Defendant may be in.
  Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Have a mental health assessment if not had one done recently and at DOC's direction and discretion.

No contact direct or indirect with Karolee Bulak with one exception. Write a letter of apology to Ms. Bulak within the first 30 days of probation. To be given to agent first before forwarding to Ms. Bulak.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage in other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA Sample
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if not had one done recently and at DOC's direction and discretion

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Henke
Current: 4281 State Highway 73, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495-8850 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2017)
Prior: 624 White Birch Ct, Appleton, WI 54915 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Henke
Current: 624 White Birch Ct, Appleton, WI 54915 United States  (Effective: 12-06-2016)
Prior: 4281 Hwy 73 North, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Michael J Henke in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:35 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is scheduled for a plea and sentencing hearing today.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2 in the complaint.

Atty Cousins states the plea agreement.
Atty Kryshak concurs.

State has filed a restitution summary.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Court takes a moment to read the victim impact statement.

Atty Kryshak has shared the victim impact statement to his client as well. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
First 90 must be in jail, balance may be on electronic monitoring if approved by jail and risk assessment
Huber granted for employment and counseling Defendant may be in
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 30 Days
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be in
To be served within the first 60 days of probation
May be served in Wood, Outagamie, Portage  or Winnebago County. Defendant and agent are to set this up
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Restitution of $204.78
No contact direct or indirect with Karolee Bulak with one exception. Write a letter of apology to Ms. Bulak within the first 30 days of probation. To be given to agent first before forwarding to Ms. Bulak.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations if not had one done recently and at DOC's direction and discretion
Have a mental health assessment if not had one done recently and at DOC's direction and discretion
Engage in other counseling as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA Sample

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 60 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be in 
May be served in Wood, Outagamie, Portage  or Winnebago County. Defendant and agent are to set this up
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge  

20 days in which to appeal case

Report to jail today as well as report to probation
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
